explanation: Vera claims the wedding reception went until midnight. But Clue 3 reveals the venue confirms the reception ended at 10 PM with guests out by 10:15 PM. Vera lied about her timeline to hide the gap in her Saturday night. Clue 2 shows someone was at the name plates on the executive floor at 10 PM Saturday night — right after Vera would have been free from the wedding. Clue 2 also clears Neil by confirming he was in the basement all Sunday morning. As office administrator, Vera would know where the hex wrench was kept and could have grabbed it Saturday evening.
funFact: Office pranks involving name plates and desk swaps spike in frequency around April Fools' Day, but revenge pranks happen year-round — facilities teams report an average of three per quarter.
